frameDefinitions: An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.
An Agent causes a Theme to move from a Source, along a Path, to a Goal.
A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
This frame contains nouns denoting Aggregates of Individuals.
A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
frameExamples: Avoid allowing light to <t>shine</t> into neighbors' gardens.
She <t>threw</t> her shoes into the dryer .
An <t><fex name='Agg'>army</fex></t> of postal workers descended on my office.
Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
David <t>placed</t> his briefcase on the floor.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the entity at the <fen>Source</fen> from which the <fen>Beam</fen> originates.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> occupies initially before its change of location.
The light that travels from a <fen>Source</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Path</fen> refers to where the <fen>Beam</fen> travels over or to a landmark the <fen>Beam</fen> travels by.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> ends up in.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the one whose action causes the motion of a <fen>Theme</fen>.  The <fen>Agent</fen> is generally realized as the External Argument.
The role <fen>Theme</fen> is generally an NP Object.
The role <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of motion.
The role <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor <fen>Goal</fen>.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the point at which the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

The role <fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element.
<fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to be set in motion.
A resultant state that the <fen>Theme</fen> is in at the end of its motion.
A previous state that the <fen>Theme</fen> was in before the beginning of its motion.
The time at which the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that provides a setting for a specific motion (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
This role identifies the people or things that form  the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
This role identifies the collection of entities that are the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Sunlight</fex> gleamed from the water of the bay.
<fex>Pat</fex> threw the china at the wall.
Pat threw <fex>the china</fex> at the wall.
Pat dragged the box <fex>out of the cupboard</fex>.
I pushed the trolley <fex>along the street</fex>.
Kim threw the cat <fex>into the garden</fex>.
Kim pushed the lawnmower <fex>around the garden</fex>.
<fex>The storm</fex> tossed the sailor from the boat
The fireman dragged the injured driver <fex>clear</fex>
Paul pulled Fran upright <fex>from her sitting position</fex>.
We shoved half of the cargo overboard <fex>on the 29th</fex>.
<fex>Candlelight</fex> sparkled on the silverware.
Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
The fire <fex><t>glowed</t></fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
A crowd <fex>of hoodlums</fex> filled the plaza.
A <fex><t>crowd</t></fex> of hoodlums filled the plaza.
<fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
I found him <fex>under the bed</fex>.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
We found it <fex>last night</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> placed the food on the table.
The waiter placed <fex>the food</fex> on the table.
The waiter placed the food <fex>on the table</fex>.
Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex>another plant which</fex> puts nitrogen into the soil .
Smithers had placed the table there <fex>the night before</fex>.
